conclusion: To determine which container (E, F, or G) the liquid from A, B, C, and D will flow into, we need to analyze the paths created by the baffles.
Liquid encounters a black bar but can flow around it.
Liquid flows downward from A and appears to be directed towards F.
Liquid encounters a brown bar and flows around it.
Liquid flows downward from B and seems to be directed towards F.
Liquid encounters a pink bar and flows around it.
Liquid flows downward from C and appears to be directed towards F.
Liquid encounters a yellow bar and flows around it.
Liquid flows downward from D and is directed towards F.
A and B direct liquid towards container F.
C and D also direct liquid towards container F.
Liquid from A, B, C, and D will all flow into container F.
The liquid will flow into container F.
